columns.text: In this problem, we need to determine how much time does the buyer have to pay for the purchased inventory before the account is overdue, what amount will he pay then, is there a discount and under what conditions he gets that discount.

**a)**  Since the supplier offers terms of $1/10$, net $30$, customers have 30 days from the invoice date to pay the full amount. If customers take the full period, he must remit amount of 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Remittance}&=300\cdot \$140\\
&=\$42,000\\
\end{align*}$$

**b)** The buyer has the option to pay for the inventory within $10$ days from the invoice date thus getting a discount of $1$ percent from the full price. If the buyer takes a discount, then he will only have to remit the next amount 
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Remittance}&=\$42,000\cdot \left(1-0.01\right)\\
&=\$42,000\cdot0.99\\
&=\$41,580\\
\end{align*}$$

**c)** The buyer can pay $\$41,580$ in $10$ days or wait another $20$ days and pay $\$42,000$.  That means the buyer is actually borrowing $\$41,580$
for $20$ days and that the buyer pays "implicit  interest" on the credit. The implicit interest is the difference between the two remittance amounts, so
$$\begin{align*}
\text{Implicit interest}&=\$42,000-\$41,580\\
&=\$420
\end{align*}$$

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
